channel.title: My Minecraft 2D Game
channel.description:
This is a simple Minecraft game that I have been working on. I hope you enjoy it!
Minecraft 2D Download - http://up.ht/hdqnI7 39dll.dll Download - http://up.ht/eWM8LL
You [u][b]MUST[/b][/u] Put The [b]Minecraft 2D Game [u]AND[/u] 39dll.dll [/b] [b]TOGETHER[/b]!! [u][b]THEN[/b][/u] Run The Game.
[IMG]http://i344.photobucket.com/albums/p348/tekidder_2008/screenshot121.png[/img]

item.title: My Minecraft 2D Game
item.dc:creator: @Graham Graham
item.description:
@Graham wrote:

[quote=“Davidi2, post:22, topic:386449”][quote author=Moparisthebest link=topic=482209.msg3531781#msg3531781 date=1300230800]

3 mods have told you to fuck off, now fuck off.

I don’t know about his past, but this ‘game’ actually seems pretty cool, and it’s clean, so I don’t know why he would ‘fuck off’.
[/quote]Basically the mods said that he should start using a real language, and that he didn’t want to see any more of these GML (Game Maker language) games. He since then broke that about 4 times, each time his topic has been deleted…[/quote]

That rule only pertains to the programming section - this is the minecraft section. Also, is there any problem with using Game Maker? It isn’t what professionals would consider but for getting a quick game up and running if you aren’t an amazing programmer it’s probably quite a useful tool.

Read full topic

item.title: My Minecraft 2D Game
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

CoonHunter:

Some programs can be converted with the source code available, but I am not sure a real binary that has been compiled for a specific machine can be converted accordingly.

Yes, sometimes source code can be ported, but binaries cannot be ‘converted’ as it were.

Read full topic

item.title: My Minecraft 2D Game
item.dc:creator: @mironic mironic
item.description:
@mironic wrote:

[quote=“GML Programmer, post:42, topic:386449”][quote author=mironic link=topic=482209.msg3538310#msg3538310 date=1300676324]

Never heard of GML, but you should compile it for Linux if you can, or release the source so others can.

To my knowledge GML only does windows.

:3 you guys are so outdated GML = game maker Light (unpaid version) wich is scripting only
but if you buy the full version you can make full games that are 3d…

Cool hint for you all the popular game “Digimon Battle online” was made useing game maker pro

but yeah you can convert any EXE to linux mac just gotta know what to do
[/quote]
GML Stands for Game Maker Language
Game Maker Lite has NO scripting(only available in the pro edition) it is strictly D&D (Drag and Drop)[/quote]
thats what i ment, i have paid version, you 2?

Read full topic

item.title: My Minecraft 2D Game
item.dc:creator: @CoonHunter CoonHunter
item.description:
@CoonHunter wrote:

[quote=“Cole1497, post:35, topic:386449”][quote author=CoonHunter link=topic=482209.msg3532768#msg3532768 date=1300310686]

The game isn’t grid-aligned. I can place blocks wherever I want.

How it should be in real minecraft.

Then it would throw off the gameplay majorly, and would become even harder to program. As well as the fact it would take up more damn memory because if that.
[/quote]
I’m sorry, what?[/quote]
Damn phone…fixed in this post.

Read full topic
